Compiler Design Unit 3 Syntax Directed Definitions Preet Kanwal Department of Computer Science & Engineering
In this lecture, you will learn about Compiler Design. To generate Syntax tree for Expressions to generate Syntax tree for Statements.
Compiler Design Example 1 SDD to generate Syntax tree for Expressions
Here is the cleaned-up version of the text: Compiler Design Example 1 SDD to generate Syntax tree for Expressions Use the previous grammar to construct the syntax tree for the input a - 4 + c
Compiler Design Example 2 SDD to generate Syntax tree for Statements
Compiler Design Example 2 SDD to generate Syntax tree for Statements
Here is the cleaned-up text: Compiler Design Example 2 - SDD to generate Syntax tree for Statements Use the previous grammar to construct the syntax tree for the input if ( x > 10 ) { x = 10; }
